p: Patients were diagnosed with severe COVID-19 if they presented with (a) dyspnea with respiratory rate ≥ 30 breaths/min, (b) finger oxygen saturation ≤ 93% at resting state, and (c) arterial partial pressure of oxygen/fractional concentration of inspired oxygen ≤300 mmHg (1 mmHg = 0.133 kPa) [ 7].
